context_of_use: This use case allows admins to create and update product information within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control product availability and pricing
description: Allow admins to create products and update pricing and product details.
preconditions: Admin is authenticated and authorized to manage products.
postconditions: Products are created or updated successfully in the system.
assumptions: Admin has the necessary permissions to manage products.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific fields required for product creation.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to create a new product → System prompts for product details.
2. Admin enters product details and submits → System creates the new product.
3. Admin selects a product to update → System displays current product information.
4. Admin updates product pricing and details → System saves the updated information.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the admin cancels the product creation, then the system returns to the main menu.
AF-2 (from Step 3): If the admin selects a product that does not exist, then the system displays an error message.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the product details are incomplete, then the system prompts the admin to complete the required fields.
